name: chicagotribune
text: A severe thunderstorm warning has been issued for parts of Cook and DuPage counties until 7:30 p.m. Intense downpours with a "lot of lightning" are expected. https://t.co/jcv9f2c9yX

name: chicagotribune
text: Update: A severe thunderstorm warning has also been issued for parts of Kane, Kendall and DeKalb counties until 7:45 p.m. https://t.co/SGipFr3HFt

name: chicagotribune
text: This remodeled 3-story penthouse loft in River North has 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a rooftop deck. Take a look inside. https://t.co/ptfJuvnk8k

name: chicagotribune
text:
A local family bought all the paletas in Don Rosario's cart to allow him to spend Father's Day with his family. They also raised nearly $40,000 for a retirement fund.

Overcome with emotion, the 70-year-old told the Tribune what the gift means to him. https://t.co/2q8civz3Kc

name: chicagotribune
text:
“In this moment of reckoning, we should appreciate what racial souvenirs tell us about how far we have come, so we have a better idea of where we’re going.”

Columnist @cptime on the history told by the racist souvenirs he amassed over the years: https://t.co/eD9MTUo5wb

name: chicagotribune
text: Thirty-five years after moving to Chicago to work at the Tribune, columnist @MarySchmich reflects on what she's come to understand about the city. https://t.co/zSCpxnqQ5I

name: chicagotribune
text: Commentary: As Chicago deals with calls to “defund the police,” a closer look at policing costs is important. Here are 5 ways law enforcement agencies could become more efficient, and even reduce the number of sworn officers. https://t.co/lBfc5UZdEM

text: Flashback: Led by Amelia Earhart, the Ninety-Nines united female pilots and allowed their ambitions to take flight https://t.co/WtMmWWBI8u

name: chicagotribune
text:
U.S. intelligence officials have concluded that a Russian military intelligence unit secretly offered bounties to Taliban-linked militants for killing coalition forces in Afghanistan — including targeting American troops.

From The New York Times. https://t.co/3GDWn2kHXg

name: chicagotribune
text: If Democrats take control of Congress in November, there may be a push to prioritize police reform or health care. These things are critical, but nothing is more critical than passage of a new Voting Rights Act, writes Miami Herald columnist Leonard Pitts. https://t.co/X2FjXnzK69

name: chicagotribune
text: A federal judge ordered the release of children held with their parents in U.S. immigration jails and denounced the Trump administration’s prolonged detention of families during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/ZGmKRirJG6

name: chicagotribune
text: President Trump ripped Gov. J.B. Pritzker and Mayor Lori Lightfoot over Chicago’s gun violence in a Friday night letter. The two Democrats called the missive a distraction. https://t.co/muJZnGkAsd

name: chicagotribune
text:
Welcome to phase four, Illinois.

Even with our best behavior, we may be here awhile. https://t.co/A5TXGv8gFw

text: “I’ve gone my whole life very happy with my name. But almost overnight, the name Karen has become slang for a particular type of woman who believes the world must bend to her wishes.” https://t.co/2XZxUwCZnQ

text: One of Chicago’s biggest luxury residential developers wants to build a 43-story apartment high-rise using air rights from a Near North Side church, but residents of a neighboring condo tower are going on the offensive to stop it. https://t.co/td2t8lpZn9

name: chicagotribune
text: Several schools have had athletes test positive for coronavirus after returning to campuses for voluntary workouts. Players have been asked to sign documents acknowledging risks. Schools say these aren't legal documents, but could they be used in court? https://t.co/wn3PBAY2H3

text: Renewed freedoms come with a caveat from public health officials: It all can be taken away again if there is a spike in confirmed coronavirus cases or hospitalization rates. Live updates https://t.co/H5iofBAzMt

text: A lot has happened since the Chicago Red Stars last played. Here’s a quick refresher — and what to watch for — heading into the NWSL Challenge Cup. https://t.co/7JCiQ0ZbBb

name: chicagotribune
text: Grant Dayton will notice one glaring absence this season after he reports to the Atlanta Braves: his twice-a-month salary. He is among 11 major leaguers whose prorated pay for the abbreviated 60-game season amounts to less than the $286,500 advance. https://t.co/67CKzpXn2S

name: chicagotribune
text: Deaths have been declining, but that trend is misleading, because they are a lagging indicator. When cases increase, deaths will eventually follow, writes @SteveChapman13 https://t.co/NTFTfZjEaE

text: Two of the largest U.S. states reversed course and reinstated some coronavirus restrictions amid a surge in new infections. https://t.co/z4yiKd0W4e
